title: Teen Leadership, Open-Source Inquiry, and Working in the Open
notes:
MozFest 2016
Teen Leadership, Open-Source Inquiry, and Working in the Open
Sunday, 12:15pm-1:15pm
Demystify The Web, Floor 7 - 702
David Bild, Chicago Academy Of Sciences / Peggy Notebaert Nature Museum
dbild@naturemuseum.org  @dbild

Slides https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1CXO8ydnYRshf3pHCLViHDe6i2gos4iM_ClNADYqfIuk/edit?usp=sharing

Participants (name, org, contact)


Session Agenda:
	* Inspiration 
		* Web Literacy Framework https://learning.mozilla.org/en-US/web-literacy/
		* Open Leadership Training Series  https://mozilla.github.io/open-leadership-training-series/
		* Science Lab Working in the Open Workshop https://mozillascience.github.io/working-open-workshop/
		* Hive Mapping Cooperative http://hivechicago.org/portfolio/hive-mapping-cooperative/ 
	* Teen personas and project scenarios
	* Brainstorm of possible online tools for building community, collaboration and contribution
	* Deepdive into tools (affordances and constraints)
	* Identification of curricular supports needed
	* Next steps
